block.p: After 10 days of debate, officials at the United Nations World Summit on Sustainable Development hammered out a plan to reduce poverty and preserve the planet. More than 100 leaders gathered in Johannesburg to produce the plan, which environmentalists condemned as weak. Leaders agreed to halve the number of people without sanitation by 2015. But the United States and oil-producing countries derailed efforts to ensure that renewable energy -- like solar and wind power -- would account for 15 percent of the world's total energy production by 2010.
